objects.name: HintGameOver
objects.string:
The adventure has only just begun... 
What will you do to complete it?

parameters: "It's time to wake up..." + NewLine() + "'" + GlobalVariableString(KeyConfirm) + "'"

initialVariables.name: Message
initialVariables.value: You should really go back down and practice your Birdsong...

parameters: "Birdsong: " + NewLine() +"'" + GlobalVariableString(KeyBlue) + "'" + NewLine() + "'" + GlobalVariableString(KeyRed) + "'"  + NewLine() + "'" + GlobalVariableString(KeyGreen) + "'"

objects.string:
Try this:

- Red
- Green
- Blue
- Blue
- Green
- Red

objects.string:
Thank you for playing.
Press '?' to end the game

objects.string: R - G - B - B - G - R

animations.name: PuzzleExit

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Gruk
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
This behavior moves an object (like an enemy) for a chosen time or distance, then flips it and starts over, moving the object back and forth, vertically or horizontally.

Note: animations must be facing **Right** (for horizontal) or **Down** (for vertical) direction.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: BirdsongExtension

eventsFunctions.description: Check the next note of the provided Birdsong puzzle. (Must have "Notes", Index", and "Solved" variables.) (Result is sent to global SongNote variable.)
eventsFunctions.name: CheckNextNote
CheckNote
eventsFunctions.sentence: Check _PARAM0_'s next note against the note the player just sang.

propertyDescriptors.label: Notes - the series of notes required to solve this birdsong. Seperate by commas.
propertyDescriptors.name: Notes

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: 4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description: Behaviors to animate Tiled Sprite objects in the background, following the camera with a parallax effect.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: TimedBackAndForthMovement
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: This behavior moves objects back and forth for a chosen time or distance, vertically or horizontally.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
Move an object (e.g. enemy) for a chosen time or distance, then flip it and start over. 
Note: animations should be facing LEFT.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: TimedBackAndForthMirroredMovement

events.comment: distance has been reached, flip it
max time has been reached, flip it
distance has been reached, flip it
max time has been reached, flip it
store current elapsed time (to make sure time has passed)

propertyDescriptors.label: Move the object vertically (instead of horizontally)
propertyDescriptors.name: Vertical

propertyDescriptors.label: position of the sprite at the previous frame
propertyDescriptors.name: LastPosition

eventsFunctions.description: Check the next note of the provided Birdsong puzzle. (Must have "Notes", Index", and "Solved" variables.) (Result is sent to global SongNote variable.)
eventsFunctions.name: CheckNextNote

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
Allows an object to move in various directions (Up, Down, Left, Right, or Still) according to event or object specific triggers.

Animations should be made as though the object were moving Up and Right.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: SBaF

eventsFunctions.description: Checks if the object is moving Up.
eventsFunctions.name: checkUp

eventsFunctions.description: Checks if the object is moving Down.
eventsFunctions.name: checkDown

eventsFunctions.description: Checks if the object is moving Left.
eventsFunctions.name: checkLeft

eventsFunctions.description: Checks if the object is moving Right.
eventsFunctions.name: checkRight

events.description: Checks if the object is holding Still.
events.name: checkStill

events.description: Changes the object's direction to Up.
events.name: changeUp

events.description: Changes the object's direction to Down.
events.name: changeDown

events.description: Changes the object's direction to Left.
events.name: changeLeft

events.description: Changes the object's direction to Right.
events.name: changeRight
GetOption

events.description: Changes the object's direction to Still.
events.name: changeStill

propertyDescriptors.label: Speed - The speed (in pixels) you want the object to move in.
propertyDescriptors.name: Speed

propertyDescriptors.label: Direction - The direction it should currently be going in. Should always be either: Up, Down, Left, Right, or Still.
propertyDescriptors.name: Direction
